required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Universal Genetic Testing Versus Guidelines-Directed Testing for Germline Pathogenic Variants Among Non-Western Patients With Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Universal Genetic Testing Versus Guidelines-Directed Testing for Germline Pathogenic Variants Among Non-Western Patients With Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to examinethe pattern and frequency of pathogenic variants among all newly diagnosed breast cancer patients in a genetically distinct population. Additionally, the uptake rate of "cascade family screening" , frequency of pathogenic variants and barriers against testing will be studied.

primary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of pathogenic or likely pathogenic germline variants among newly diagnosed breast cancer patients tested by universal multigene panel testing or guideline-based targeted testing
Number of participants with variants of uncertain significance (VUS) as assessed by universal multigene panel testing versus guideline-based targeted testing
The reasons/ Barriers for refusal of genetic cascade testing among newly diagnosed cancer patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of cascade testing of family members of the participants with positive pathogenic mutation
secondary_outcome.description: The family of the positive patients will be offered the genetic testing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of pathogenic or likely pathogenic mutations among family members of the patients with pathogenic mutations using the universal multigene panel
Prevalence of variants of uncertain significance (VUS) among tested family members of participants with pathogenic mutations as assessed by universal multigene panel testing
The reasons/ Barriers for refusal of genetic cascade testing among family members of the tested patients with pathogenic mutations

arm_group.description: All adult patients with a confirmed diagnosis of breast cancer, aged 18 or older at time of cancer diagnosis, will be invited to participate.

study_pop.textblock:
All consecutive patients who fulfill the inclusion/exclusion criteria, and are treated and followed up at KHCC will be invited.
A total of 1000 patients are estimated to participate

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patient, age â‰¥ 18 years at time of cancer diagnosis
- Pathology proven diagnosis of breast cancer (including DCIS); any stage. (prior history of cancer is allowed)
- Willingness to participate
- Signed consent form.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Major psychiatric disorder (defined as: patients followed by a psychiatrist and on antipsychotic medications

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor, Chairman of department of medicine, Chief Medical officer, Deputy Director General
